input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.
Specifies the globally unique identifier (GUID) of the partition containing the operating system from which the boot entry is being copied.

Specifies the globally unique identifier (GUID) of the partition containing the operating system for which you are creating the cloned boot entry.
Not applicable to Post Vista Window OS
Specifies the boot entry to be copied. Not applicable to Post Vista Window OS

Applies the specified friendly name to the cloned boot entry.
Not applicable to Post Vista Window OS

Appends the specified text to the existing friendly name for the boot entry specified with the /id parameter. When /d+ is used with the /sg parameter
Not applicable to Post Vista Window OS

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Windows Server 2008"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported by Windows Server 2008</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/bin/echo "Not Supported."</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/bin/echo "Not Supported."</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">bootcfg /clone</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${sg}')"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /sg ${sg}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${tg}')"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /tg ${tg}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${id}')"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /id ${id}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${description}')"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /d ${description}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${add description}')"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /d+ ${add description}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: On Itanium-based computers, creates a copy of an Extensible Firmware Interface (EFI) boot entry for use in a mirrored boot volume.
